archlinux/2017-02-06-archlinux-battery-l.title: Maximise battery life on Arch Linux
archlinux/2017-02-06-archlinux-battery-l.body:
Maximise battery life on Archlinux
2017-02-06 18:03:15 +0100
Acpid:
acpid2 is a flexible and extensible daemon for delivering ACPI events.
# pacman -S acpid
# systemctl enable acpid.service 
# systemctl start acpid.service

TLP:
TLP brings you the benefits of advanced power management for Linux without the need to understand every technical detail.
# pacman -S tlp
# pacman -S ethtool smartmontools x86_energy_perf_policy
# systemctl enable tlp.service tlp-sleep.service

Microcode:
# pacman -S intel-ucode 
# grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg

Linux monitoring sensors and CPU frequency scaling
# pacman -S lm_sensors 
# yaourt -S thermald
# systemctl start thermald.service 
# systemctl enable thermald.service

Powertop
If you don't have enoght with all this, use the powertop optimizer
# pacman -S powertop
# powertop

archlinux/2017-02-05-archlinux-ssd-confi.title: Configure SSD on Arch Linux for Slimbook
archlinux/2017-02-05-archlinux-ssd-confi.body:
Configure SSD on Archlinux for Slimbook"
2017-02-05 10:03:15 +0100
Mount tmp dir in RAM memory:
Using the ram memory as tmp dir we avoid unnecessary writings in disc, for this we have to edit fstab:
# vim /etc/fstab
tmpfs    /tmp    tmpfs    noatime,nodiratime,nodev,nosuid,mode=1777,size=2G,defaults    0    0
tmpfs    /var/tmp    tmpfs    noatime,nodiratime,nodev,nosuid,mode=1777,size=2G,defaults    0    0

Reduce the use of swap memory:
The swap partition can be used even if free memory is left. Editing sysctl we can reduce his use.
# vim /etc/sysctl.d/99-swap.conf
vm.swappiness=1
vm.vfs_cache_pressure=50
vm.dirty_writeback_centisecs=1500

TRIM
Most SSDs support the ATA_TRIM command for sustained long-term performance and wear-leveling.
To verify TRIM support, run:
# lsblk -D
NAME           DISC-ALN DISC-GRAN DISC-MAX DISC-ZERO
sda                   0      512B       2G         0
├─sda1                0      512B       2G         0
└─sda2                0      512B       2G         0
  └─lvm               0      512B       2G         0
    ├─Vol-swap        0      512B       2G         0
    └─Vol-root        0      512B       2G         0

And check the values of DISC-GRAN and DISC-MAX columns. Non-zero values indicate TRIM support.
Or install hdparm package and run:
# pacman -S hdparm
# hdparm -I /dev/sda | grep TRIM
    *    Data Set Management TRIM supported (limit 1 block)

The fstrim command analyzes the disc, and it controls and regroups the memory blocks, making the disk management faster.
# /sbin/fstrim --all

fstrim can be periodic execute thanks fstrim.service and fstrim.timer systemd unit files, provided in util-linux package.
# systemctl start fstrim.timer && systemctl enable fstrim.timer
# systemctl list-timers --all
NEXT                         LEFT     LAST                         PASSED       UNIT                         ACTIVATES
Mon 2017-02-06 00:00:00 CET  11h left Mon 2017-01-30 17:53:25 CET  5 days ago   fstrim.timer                 fstrim.service

Desactivate the I/O algorithm
Since they are not rotating discs, it is not necessary to calculate the algorithm. To deactivate it:
# vim /etc/default/grub 
GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="cryptdevice=/dev/sda2:lvm root=/dev/mapper/Vol-root elevator=noop"
# grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg

archlinux/2017-01-30-archlinux-on-slimbo.title: Install Arch Linux on Slimbook
archlinux/2017-01-30-archlinux-on-slimbo.body:
Install Archlinux on Slimbook"
2017-01-30 10:03:15 +0100
First steps:
# loadkeys es
# systemctl start sshd
# passwd
# timedatectl set-ntp true

Partition the disks:
Create one partition boot and and another for the rest.
# fdisk /dev/sda

Disposit.  Inicio Comienzo     Final  Sectores Tamaño Id Tipo
/dev/sda1             2048    821247    819200   400M 83 Linux
/dev/sda2           821248 234441647 233620400 111,4G 83 Linux

Encrypt the disc:
# cryptsetup luksFormat /dev/sda2
# cryptsetup open /dev/sda2 cryptolvm

Create root and swap volumes:
# vgcreate Vol /dev/mapper/cryptolvm
# lvcreate -L 8G Vol -n swap
# lvcreate -l 100%FREE Vol -n root

Format the partitions:
# mkfs.ext4 /dev/mapper/Vol-root
# mkswap /dev/mapper/Vol-swap
# mkfs.ext2 /dev/sda1

Mount the file systems:
# mount /dev/mapper/Vol-root /mnt
# swapon /dev/mapper/Vol-swap
# mkdir /mnt/boot
# mount /dev/sda1 /mnt/boot

Install the base packages:
# pacstrap /mnt base base-devel

Generate fstab:
# genfstab -U /mnt >> /mnt/etc/fstab

Change root into the new system:
# arch-chroot /mnt

Configurate time zone:
# ln -s /usr/share/zoneinfo/Europe/Madrid /etc/localtime
# ls -l /etc/localtime
# rm /etc/localtime
# ln -s /usr/share/zoneinfo/Europe/Madrid /etc/localtime
# hwclock --systohc

# pacman -S vim

Configurate locale:
# vim /etc/locale.gen
# locale-gen
# vim /etc/locale.conf
LANG=es_ES.utf8
# vim /etc/vconsole.conf
KEYMAP=es

Configurate hostname:
# vim /etc/hostname
slimbook

Initramfs:
# vim /etc/mkinitcpio.conf
HOOKS="base udev autodetect modconf block encrypt lvm2 resume filesystems keyboard fsck"
# mkinitcpio -p linux

# passwd

Boot loader
# pacman -S grub
# grub-install --target=i386-pc /dev/sda
# vim /etc/default/grub
GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="cryptdevice=/dev/sda2:lvm root=/dev/mapper/Vol-root elevator=noop"
GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet resume=/dev/mapper/Vol-swap"
# grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg

reboot
Add user:
# useradd -m -g users -G wheel -s /bin/bash cesar

Install graphical user interface:
# pacman -S xf86-video-intel
# pacman -S xorg
# pacman -S plasma
# pacman -S bash-completion

Note: ifconfig is deprecated, use ip addr: https://www.archlinux.org/news/deprecation-of-net-tools/
